title: I'm sick of these "Where's Urf?" posts
body:
I'm truly sick of it. Riot said over a month ago that there would be no Urf. Also the people saying "Oh we will only have four days of Urf this year with each weekend of it being two days" are false. Here is what L4T3NCY said when asked "What times exactly is the queue going to be active?":
We’re aiming to have the queue available every weekend starting around Friday afternoon and switching off sometime early on Monday morning. This will be in the local time for each region. The goal is to have it up once the weekend starts (that’s Friday night right?! :P) so we should get three evenings of fast game mode funtimes. This is just a first implementation, if the queue proves to be exceedingly popular, we can always lengthen the window.

So this means that Urf could be here from Friday afternoon until the next gamemode is put live. This means 7 days of Urf and it would happen twice, resulting in 14 days total of Urf, which is the same as last year.

Edit: I sick of the Rengar killing Draven gifs too.

1.) Pick the most overbearing long range casters. AKA {{champion:81}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:101}} , etc. Use them in a team of five. (Edit: this most likely includes {{champion:202}} now)

2.) pick the most ridiculous close range champs you can think of. champs who will REALLY just rip you a new one if you get even remotely close to them, like 1000 units.

replies.body:
I'd be fine with having URF if people wouldn't whine about it. The more whining I see, the luckier people are that I'm not in charge at Riot.

Because at this point I'd be handling them all like children: "keep complaining and NOBODY is getting URF......oh? you don't believe me? Okay. URF is permanently in the vault. You'll never see it again. You COULD have WAITED and LISTENED to what we said, but no. You thought that by whining you'd get your way. Sorry kids! Not happening."

Seriously. I just want to take the game-mode and put it away forever thanks to this annoyance. It'd be fine if it stayed on the boards but I can't go to Facebook, Youtube, or Twitch without hearing it too.

People are lazy enough to not read anything about the rotating game modes, but not lazy enough to flood the board with posts about something they are have no information at all. And anyway URF is cool but it kinda gets old since it always has a strong meta with little variety.
http://cdn.makeagif.com/media/8-22-2014/_wepY7.gif
I don't even get why people want it back, the only gamemode that was worse was the one-for-all on howling abyss

Im not sure where this information was released that there would be no URF this year. Im on the boards and playing LoL every single day and I had no idea about it what so ever.

Im not really in an uproar about the lack of URF, but I do find all the draven heads to be extremely annoying in games. I would have preferred they just did nothing tbh.

But this whole thing speaks to a larger issue riot has had for quite a while. They don't really make it easy for people to find important information if they aren't seriously looking for it. If someone, based on the fact that URF was put out the previous two april fools days, simply assumed URF would be out again this april fools, and didn't bother to investigate the matter, its really not their fault. By releasing URF the previous two years, riot created a precedent by which people would base an assumption, and without making it painfully easy for said peoples to know that this assumption was incorrect, they can be said to have seriously dropped the ball.

Say what you will about this years april fools and the people complaining about no URF; but you really cant deny riot has always had a major problem with communicating information to their community members that don't want to or don't have the time to invest in digging around the site for it.
well at least WHERE IS SOLO QUE died down a bit

Well, give the community a little credit:  From the first time URF was rolled out to the second time it was rolled out, you would get "Bring Back URF" posts on every fucking news release, all year round.  This season, the URF QQ'ers have been relatively quiet, and only expected URF around this time.  I'd say that compared to last year, they've been relatively restrained.

Plus, while I didn't like URF when it first rolled out, I loved it the second time around.  I guess it's because I discovered this bastard:  {{champion:13}} Complete faceroll every game.  Like 30 kills.  Although I need to give credit to my partner-in-crime, {{champion:17}} , whose shrooms littered the map and served as teleportation points so I could come from any direction at just about any time.  This is the anti-tilt game; it's just great for messing around and de-stressing.
Well then it looks like the moral is that "patience pays off." Unfortunately, there's a not of impatient people complaining right now.
